Posts.Content: janet1723 wrote: Hi ladies, I have been treated for breast cancer since 2003 (my first time around was actually 1989 which was considered cured).  This time I have had a mastectomy and reconstruction,  followed by the mammary node removal in 2005, but then in late 2005, 3 new spots in the region were located.  I had navalbine through most of 2006, which made the centers nectrotic.  In early 2007 I started gemzar, which held the size of the mass steady.  However, about 2 months ago, it was found that the mass had embedded itself between my ribs and was fracturing them, plus it collapsed the top half of my left lung.  lots of pain (I  also have congestive heart failure)  (I'm only 49!!!) So now I have begun weekly treatments of taxotere.  I just had my 5th and I have been so tired and weak and have difficulty breathing.   Not to mention everything tastes like salt.  After 6 taxotere, I will be re-cat-scanned to see how it's doing.  My pain is much better, so I am optimistic, but this stuff is harsh for me. I have very little support - my parents are gone, I am long separated, I have a son, 23, who lives with me, and then I have my daughter, 21, who is away at college in her senior year.  I try not to overburden her, but it's hard on all. I believe i will be healed, I have the best dr., and I am not used to being so dependent.  Any advice you can offer, especially regarding the taxotere, I would be grateful for.  At the present I take a steroid and about 4 percoset a day for pain. Thank you so much, Janet Dx 4/2003, 0/0 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
